intro: Oxydectes cortesiana, commonly known as the Mexican redwood, is a unique plant native to the highlands of Mexico. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing a rugged appearance. Oxydectes cortesiana is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
